result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grant N. Stamper

records.addlTxt: Request and Response Regarding Open Records - Criminal Complaint emailed 09-26-2022

Order to Modify Bond.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's bond be amended to read: the defendant is to have no contact with anyone under the age of 18, with the except of his niece, H.S., DOB: 11-13-2017, whom he is allowed to have supervised contact that is supervised by H.S.'s mother only.  It is hereby ordered that all other terms and conditions of the defendant's bond remain unchanged.
Scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:44 pm - Defendant Grant N. Stamper in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Grant N. Stamper.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
1) Brandon Radke, Detective Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department, sworn and testified.
Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Defendant waives the reading of the Information.
Not guilty plea entered to the charge contained in the Information.  Jury Calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

At 4:25 pm, case recalled. All parties present as before.  
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Defendant is requested to be able to have contact with his niece.  The State objects.
The Court will allow contact with his niece as long as the contact is supervised by the mother.  
Attorney Kippa to draft the order.

2:16 pm - Defendant Grant N. Stamper in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Grant N. Stamper.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. Preliminary hearing is set for 09-07-22 at 3:00 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-17-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of  child enticement and use of a computer to facilitate a child sex crime.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-22-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 and that he not use of possess any internet enabled devices.    Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTSO.
Minutes.
